explanation: [0-0] A man in a gray shirt is standing in front of a large display screen mounted on a white wall. The screen shows two smaller screens with display errors and a gap between them. He is holding the malfunctioning part of the screen with his right hand. A blue and yellow logo is visible in the lower left corner of the screen.

[0-7] Next, the man uses his left hand to remove the upper malfunctioning screen, flips it over, and reinstalls it. Then he takes down the lower malfunctioning screen, flips it over, and reinstalls it as well.

[7-15] Finally, the man turns sideways and takes out a display screen from behind him. The back of the screen reveals complex circuit boards under a black frame. The man holds the screen with his right hand and reaches behind the large display screen with his left hand to grab a red connector, which he then plugs into the back of the screen in his hand. He lifts the screen, and it now displays an image. He then snaps the screen onto the large display screen.
